channel.title: 508 help
channel.description: When i downloaded a source and extracted it to my Desktop, i clicked the source and clicked run, a black screen would show up and then close RIGHT AWAY! Please help me :o

[/quote]On some servers you need jdk to run the server…[/quote]Show me.

item.title: 508 help
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“lildude783, post:8, topic:320518”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=416988.msg3066462#msg3066462 date=1261257025]
It’s not the compiler you tards. Running the server has to do with the JRE (Java Runtime Environment).
[/quote]

actually thats wrong… my servers run off of JDK…[/quote]That’s retarded.
Look again.

@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause
Java.exe is in the jre folder.

Read full topic

item.title: 508 help
item.dc:creator: @lildude783 lildude783
item.description:
@lildude783 wrote:

[quote=“DeltaLegitz, post:5, topic:320518”][quote author=tinyscape link=topic=416988.msg3066384#msg3066384 date=1261253847]
Edit run.bat then change the jdk version to yours, thats if it needs jdk to run it.
[/quote]

It’s not the JDK… He has to put pause at the end.[/quote]

actually… ur wrong there…

u dont need a pause at the end… becuz if you run a server… the java and jdk will keep it up… once the jpanel or source is shut off by a voule or a hacker it’ll then end the thing…

this is what the runserver shud look like

@echo off Color NUMBER AND LETTER COMBINATION HERE Title PUT A TITLE HERE "C:\Program Files\Java\JDK folder name\bin\javac.exe" nameofsourcefolder/server port pause (not needed but can have)

the nameofsourcefolder/server port is just for bulby bases… or bases that reguire that and have a random port chosen…

Read full topic

tinyscape:

Edit run.bat then change the jdk version to yours, thats if it needs jdk to run it.

It’s not the JDK… He has to put pause at the end.

item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

Edit the run.bat or whatever the batch file you clicked to run the source, and make sure at the bottom of it, you see this:

pause
